message.content:
cs.AI, cs.GT, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.SE 

The paper discusses experimental research in General Game Playing (GGP), which involves designing agents and systems to play games described by different formalisms. This falls under the category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) as GGP is a subfield of AI. The paper also discusses fairness and reproducibility of comparisons between different GGP agents and systems, which is related to Game Theory (cs.GT) and Learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper mentions the use of chaotic methods in the past, which could be related to Systems and Control (cs.SY). Finally, the paper proposes recommendations for future research, which could fall under Software Engineering (cs.SE) as it involves improving the methodology and practices of experimental research.
